intro: Satureja abyssinica, commonly known as Ethiopian thyme, is a perennial herb native to the highlands of Ethiopia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–40 cm and produces small, pink or purple flowers. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine and as a spice due to their aromatic properties. Satureja abyssinica thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments.
